intro: Guatteria paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its fruits are berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. Guatteria paraensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by providing food for various wildlife species.
